level.text: A court of the District may grant any relief normally available under the law of the District to enforce a registered child-custody determination made by a court of another state.
A court of the District shall recognize and enforce, but may not modify, except in accordance with subchapter II of this chapter, a registered child-custody determination of a court of another state.

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For D.C. Law 13-293, see notes following ยง 16-4601.01.

level.heading: Uniform Law
level.text: This section is based upon ยง 306 of the Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act (1997 Act). See 9, Part IA, Uniform Laws Annotated, Master Edition, or ULA Database on Westlaw.
